title: How the hell do i get s- or s ratings as katarina
body:
mastery lvl 6 seems so difficult to get. I got my first s- rating, then won a few others, but these matches had better scores than the one in which i got s-.

S- rating game : http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/144989239/201161051?tab=overview

Games that followed shortly: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/145000774/201161051?tab=stats

                                                 http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/144989898/201161051?tab=overview


Dont ask me why im playing kat adc and jg, thats how desperate i am to get these ratings :>. The two games i was playing kat adc and one game was me playing kat jg.

replies.body:
look at your damage output compared to the rest of your team.

S- game you and Varus had 60k ea. compared to the next highest at 40k then 20k.

Other game Teemo and Ahri did roughly same damage as you.

Last game you literally only outdamaged the support.

Ratings aren't just based on K/D/A although that is a big part.
does playing katarina in different roles help? The one where i got s- was me playing as adc

Yes actually.

The gist of how mastery ranks work is it takes your champion, then takes your role, and compares your score against other players in the server who played the same champion role combination.

So if you play hilariously off meta picks like katarina adc you will easily get S ranks, because you are being compared against probably a couple hundred people at most, and not all of them will be good.

if you play her mid you are being compared against pretty much everyone that plays kat.

For instance i used to play hecarim adc a fair bit and id get near constant S ranks.

Same with lucian top.

Where as my main (akali mid) it takes a chunk more effort for me to maintain my S rank average.

Source: I have multiple mastery 7's and 6's
Ive played mid until now as i was only receiving As

> [{quoted}](name=REAKTOR 6,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=VhO7Yf5V,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-08-30T06:37:36.161+0000)
>
> I will say this. "Expectations". Assassins and ADCs are 'expected' to get an insane amount of kills to get S- and above.
> Not saying that supports have low expectations, but this is why supports are so much easier to get S- and above, since supports mainly get assists. My first S was on Janna and that was a loss :P
> 
> {{champion:40}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:40}}

When masteries were added to ARAM not that long ago (I only ARAM), I had at least 3 s grades on Janna within a week or so. And this is ARAM, so I'm not even picking her. That was like 4 games with Janna, 3 s grades and an a+.
Nami is also an easy support to get an s on in ARAM, others like Sona are a bit harder. Just build full AP rather than support and get your support s grades in ARAM.

I think that in order to really succeed in a different role (with whatever champ you use), you have to play that role well. So for a Kat ADC, your physical damage would need to be higher than other Kat ADC's. Other things like destroying towers, inhibs and the like would also play a part in a good ranking for the ADC. If you play a Kat ADC, don't play the same as you would a mid role, because you aren't going to be as successful.

Likewise if you played a Kat support, if you place a lot of wards, get a lot of assists and very few deaths you are going to perform better than if you simply go a Kat with exhaust and play a typical assassin role.

You have to remember that you are being compared to other Kat players on your server.

This [link](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery) goes to the Champion Mastery FAQ that has some of the finer details about getting higher ranks.

Your KDA is pretty good, but CS is low and deaths are high.

I've found the best way to get an S on any champ is to minimise your deaths. You want to have a good K/D ratio to get a high score. Also keep your CS up through out the game. Maybe aim for about 6-7 per minute.
